Key Match Events: Sarr scored a penalty in the 71st minute.
Mendy received a yellow card in the 42nd minute.
Diallo received a yellow card in the 69th minute.
Mane received a yellow card in the 87th minute.
Hadji Malick Diouf received a yellow card in the 90+6th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Burundi made a dream start to their Africa Cup of Nations qualifiers.
Senegal aimed to bounce back from a late heartbreak in their opening encounter against Burkina Faso.
Senegal were unbeaten in 12 of their last 13 matches, with the only defeat coming against Ivory Coast.
Senegal were expected to be major contenders for next year's continental prize.
Senegal had won both of the previous two meetings against Burundi by a combined score of 5-1.
Burundi won consecutive games for the first time since 2020 and were without defeat in four straight outings.
Burundi aimed to make it through to the AFCON finals for the first time since 2019.
